com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.multi

Class ServiceStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.multi.ServiceStore

  • public class ServiceStore
extends java.lang.Object
    Default implementation of persistent storage which keeps track of the services that have been added to a dynamic multi-scheduler. The developer is expected to provide a ServiceFactory callback which constructs the service objects themselves. This callback is provided with a 100KB context buffer for each service to store sufficient information to reconstruct that service. The flow is intentionally structured so that ServiceFactory is exercised at least once before the context is persisted.

    • Constructor Detail

        public ServiceStore(Persister persister,

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.util.Optional<byte[]> get(java.lang.String serviceName)
                               throws PersisterException
        This is called to get the context information which was previously stored via #put(String, byte[]). Returns the specified entry value if it exists, or an empty Optional if it doesn't. The byte array may be null if service entry exists, but the context data was null when originally passed via #put(String, byte[]).
        Throws:
        PersisterException - in the event of issues with storage access

      • recover

        public java.util.Collection<AbstractScheduler> recover()
                                                throws PersisterException
        This should be invoked during Scheduler process initialization to recover any currently-running services. Returns a list of reconstructed service objects. Any services which failed to be reconstructed (due to problems in the developer-provided factory) are omitted from the returned list.
        Throws:
        PersisterException - in the event of issues with storage access

      • put

        public AbstractScheduler put(byte[] context)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This is called when the user has submitted a new service to be run, or wants to replace an existing service with a different config. Generates the service object, THEN stores the data after it's shown to have worked. Returns the resulting service object which can then be passed to the MultiServiceManager to start running the service.
        Parameters:
        context - an arbitrary blob of context data to be passed to the developer's ServiceFactory when recovering this service, or null for null to be passed to the ServiceFactory, which is no greater than 100KB in length (100 * 1024 bytes)
        Returns:
        the resulting scheduler object which may then be added to the MultiServiceManager
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are issues with storage access, if the context exceeds 100KB, or if generating the service using the factory fails

      • getUninstallCallback

        public MultiServiceEventClient.UninstallCallback getUninstallCallback()
        Returns an uninstall callback which should be invoked when an added service is ready to be cleaned up. This callback may be passed to the MultiServiceEventClient.
